newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU to study Lonrho stake deal.
newsitem.headline: EU to study Lonrho stake deal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it would study a deal to sell a large stake in Lonrho Plc to South African black mining group JCI Ltd but stressed that at this stage its interest was purely routine.

A spokesman for European competition commissioner Karel van Miert said it was far too early to judge whether the move satisfied its decision in April to force Anglo American Corp to dispose of its Lonrho holdings.
"We have been informed and are presently studying the details...But we are in no position to make a formal analysis," he said. He could not say how long the process would last.

JCI on Wednesday announced it had an option to buy 26.8 percent of Lonrho from Anglo and De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd for 2.5 billion rand, just two days after merger talks between JCI and the British firm were abandoned.
The move solves a problem for Anglo, which was forced by the Commission to place all but 9.99 percent of its Lonrho stake into a trust and seek a sale within two years.
The EU's competition watchdog objected to the purchase on the grounds that it gave the South African giant too much control over the world's platinum market.

The ruling was the first time ever that the commission used its power to force a listed company to dispose of a stake, underlining its concern that the move would allow Anglo to control world output of platinum -- a precious metal used mainly in the manufacture of cataytic converters in car exhaust systems.
